page.title: 07Birdwatching
page.content: Going on holiday to the coast is a real treat for me. It is lovely to see all the seabirds. One thing you will need to be a succesful birdwatcher is a pair of binoculars. A good pair of binoculars will cost about Â£13. I go birdwatching as often as I can. There are many good birdwatching huts around the country, and even if you can't see any birds it's nice to see the countryside. When you are watching a bird and you want to get closer for a better look you should always follow these rules: 1) Creep up silently and slowly. 2) Do not get too near the bird. 3) Sudden noises will frighten birds. 4) Never pick up an egg from a nest and put it back because your scent will cause the mother to neglect it. 5) A bird may mistake a pointing finger for a gun.
